intro: Obione conduplicata, commonly known as the double-leafed fern, is a rare and delicate species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its unique fronds that are divided into two distinct lobes, giving it its common name. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are covered in a fine layer of trichomes, which help retain moisture in its native habitat. Due to its specific ecological requirements, Obione conduplicata is often considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
